Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    class Graph, including variables about the vertices and adjacency matrix about the graph, and methods about graph coloring
    Author:
    Jiaqi Zhang

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean[][] adjMatrix 
      private int length 
      private int MAX 
      private int[] vertices

      constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearColor()
      clear the whole graph to uncolored state
      boolean getAdj(int i, int j)
      check whether i and j are connected
      pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX && j >= 0 && j < MAX
      post-condition: return adjMatrix[i][j]
      time complexity: Big Theta(1)
      int getLength()
      get the max index are used for the graph
      int getNextUncolored(int start)
      find the first vertex uncolored from the start point
      pre-condition: start >= 0 && start <= length
      post-condition: return the first vertex uncolored from the start point
      int getV(int i)
      get the value of vertex i
      pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX
      post-condition: vertices[i]
      boolean isAllColored()
      to check if all vertices of the graph are colored
      void setAdj(int i, int j)
      links i and j
      pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX && j >= 0 && j < MAX
      post-condition: adjMatrix[i][j] becomes true, length is updated
      time complexity: Big Theta(1)
      void setV(int i, int k)
      set the value of vertex i
      pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX
      post-condition: set k to vertices[i]
      java.lang.String toString()
      override the toString method

    • Method Detail

      • setAdj

        public void setAdj(int i,
                   int j)
        links i and j
        pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX && j >= 0 && j < MAX
        post-condition: adjMatrix[i][j] becomes true, length is updated
        time complexity: Big Theta(1)
        Parameters:
        i - course 1
        j - course 2

      • getAdj

        public boolean getAdj(int i,
                      int j)
        check whether i and j are connected
        pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX && j >= 0 && j < MAX
        post-condition: return adjMatrix[i][j]
        time complexity: Big Theta(1)
        Parameters:
        i - course 1
        j - course 2
        Returns:
        true if i and j are connected false otherwise

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        get the max index are used for the graph
        Returns:
        the max index that used

      • getV

        public int getV(int i)
        get the value of vertex i
        pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX
        post-condition: vertices[i]
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the vertex
        Returns:
        if it is colored

      • setV

        public void setV(int i,
                 int k)
        set the value of vertex i
        pre-condition: i >= 0 && i < MAX
        post-condition: set k to vertices[i]
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the vertex
        k - the value to set to the vertex

      • getNextUncolored

        public int getNextUncolored(int start)
        find the first vertex uncolored from the start point
        pre-condition: start >= 0 && start <= length
        post-condition: return the first vertex uncolored from the start point
        Parameters:
        start - the vertex to start the searching process
        Returns:
        the first vertex uncolored from the start point

      • isAllColored

        public boolean isAllColored()
        to check if all vertices of the graph are colored
        Returns:
        true if all vertices of the graph are colored false otherwise
